data.title: My Hero Academia season 7, episode 13 release date and Crunchyroll streaming time
data.meta_description: My Hero Academia season 7, episode 13 release date and streaming time on Crunchyroll
data.text:
My Hero Academia season 7, episode 13 is subject to another break and delay due to the ongoing Summer Olympics. But even though the My Hero Academia manga may have ended, the anime is still going strong despite the slight bump in the road.

Want to avoid spoilers and story chatter on social media about what comes next? Our guide to the My Hero Academia season 7, episode 13 release date includes the new US and UK streaming time on Crunchyroll, so you can watch the latest episode as soon as it's live in the west.

For more from the world of anime, check out the latest on One-Punch Man season 3, the Demon Slayer Infinity Castle movie trilogy and all the new anime coming your way in 2024.

The My Hero Academia season 7, episode 13 release date is Saturday August 17 at 2:30 AM Pacific/5:30 AM Eastern in the US on Crunchyroll. That's 10:30 AM BST in the UK.

For other regions, use the time zone converter.

My Hero Academia season 7 is currently on a brief break due to the ongoing Olympic games being broadcast in Japan.

The English subtitled episodes are currently two weeks behind, so expect the English sub of episode 13 to be available in late August.

My Hero Academia season 7 release schedule: when are new episodes out?

My Hero Academia season 7 kicked off on May 4. Before then, four recap episodes served as a great refresher for lapsed fans or a nice way back into the fold for those who don't want to binge the first six seasons again.

The current confirmed My Hero Academia season 7 release schedule looks like this, with new episodes expected to air weekly on Saturdays:

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 1 - May 4, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 2 - May 11, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 3 - May 18, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 4 - May 25, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 5 - June 1, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 6 - June 8, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 7 - June 15, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 8 - June 22, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 9 - June 29, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 10 - July 13, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 11 - July 20, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 12 - August 3, 2024 - out now!

My Hero Academia season 7, episode 13 - August 17, 2024

How many episodes are in My Hero Academia season 7?

The My Hero Academia season 7 episode count is 21 episodes. It'll be divided into two cours, meaning that the season will likely be split into two parts of nine episodes and 12 episodes respectively.

The two cours were split by a one-week break in July, which means the season should now end in October. 12 episodes have aired so far.

When including the 'Memories' four-part recap episodes, My Hero Academia season 7 consists of 25 episodes total.

Where to watch My Hero Academia

The subbed version of My Hero Academia season 7 will air on Crunchyroll. All six previous seasons are also available on Crunchyroll. Some seasons of the anime are also available on Netflix in some regions.

Other language dubs, including English, French, German, Latin American Spanish, and Italian, will be available at a later date.
